intro: Phaenohoffmannia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate Hoffmann's phaeno, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its ovate, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to dry conditions. Its roots are fibrous and help it retain moisture in sandy soils. It is native to parts of Africa and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
